Orange ball + blue paddles created strong contrast, helped readability
Ball rendered as 20 color dabs instead of solid fill - optical mixing effect
Ball remains brightest element, draws eye naturally

result_quality.user_feedback: Painterly style looks great, gameplay completely unchanged as required

result_notes: Broken color technique (20 dabs per ball) created painterly feel without losing ball recognition
Silhouette protection was critical - ball must remain clearly circular
Performance stayed at 60fps despite layered rendering
Impasto paddle texture added visual interest without cluttering
Reference image (Monet water lilies) helped maintain impressionist authenticity
Background atmospheric effect subtle but effective
All game logic preserved - collision, input, AI untouched
keep_for_future: Preserve all game logic when doing reskins - ONLY modify render functions
Test gameplay after each visual change to ensure no regressions
Broken color (multiple dabs) works better than gradients for painterly style
Silhouette protection prevents over-decoration in game objects
Use complementary colors for critical game elements (ball vs paddles)
Reference real art (Monet) to maintain style authenticity
Layer color patches rather than smooth blends
Keep brushstroke direction consistent (suggests light source)
Readability trumps artistic ambition in gameplay
Simple composition (3 objects) perfect for testing new techniques
avoid_for_future: Don't modify game logic 'for realism' in reskin projects
Don't use smooth linear gradients in painterly style - kills the effect
Don't over-noise shapes - ball must remain recognizable
Don't add particle systems without requirement - scope creep
Don't forget to test collision detection after visual changes
Don't apply degradation to modern objects (age check first)
Don't mix photorealistic detail with impressionist abstraction
